alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 05 at 4:38PM CDT until September 05 at 7:40PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Montgomery County in western Arkansas... * Until 740 PM CDT. * At 438 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Norman, Mimosa, Albert Pike Recreation Area, Little Missouri Falls Recreation Area, Black Springs, Fancyhill and Hopper. This includes the following streams and drainages... Caddo River, Long Creek, Polk Creek, Hyatt Creek, Crooked Creek, Little Missouri River, Hamilton Creek, South Fork Caddo River, Forrester Branch, Brier Creek, Lick Creek, Straight Creek, Blocker Creek, Reeves Branch, South Fork Ouachita River, Big Hill Creek, Viles Branch, Sloan Branch, Hewing Branch, East Saline Creek, Caney Creek, Mill Creek, Sulphur Creek and Kates Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
